Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Steam (ST): "This little scheme of yours is far more interesting than the manuscript I wrote. In that case, it wouldn't be fitting to hand it over to you. ...It was always a worthless story. I wanted to lure my ignorant readers into lauding it, making them feel as though they'd performed some magnificent reasoning.
Umineko Project (UP): "This little scheme of yours is far more interesting than the manuscript I wrote. Which is why this manuscript is unsuitable for your company. ......It was always a worthless story. Mere junk prose to entice my ignorant readers into somehow ignoring their own ignorance and feeling as though they have exhausted the limits of reasoning."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "This little scheme of yours is far more interesting than the manuscript I wrote. In that case, it wouldn't be fitting to hand it over to you. ......It was always a worthless story. Just something for my ignorant readers to put on their shelves and let them think that they've managed to solve a great puzzle.
PC Japanese (JP): 「私が書いた原稿より、あなた方のシナリオの方が面白い。ですから、この原稿は御社にお預けするに相応しくありません。……元より、下らなき原稿。無知蒙昧なる読者が、如何にそれを棚に上げて、自身が推理の限りを尽くしたかのような気分になるよう誘導するだけの駄文。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私が書いた原稿より、あなた方のシナリオの方が面白い。ですから、この原稿は御社にお預けするに相応しくありません。……元より、下らなき原稿。無知蒙昧なる読者が、如何にそれを棚に上げて、自身が推理の限りを尽くしたかのような気分になるよう誘導するだけの駄文」
Russian (RU): "Ваша авантюра гораздо интереснее написанной мной рукописи. Было бы неуместно отдавать её вам. ......Она всегда была никудышной историей. Всего лишь тем, что мои невежественные читатели ставят на полку, думая, что сумели разгадать великую загадку."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Esse seu esqueminha é muito mais interessante que o manuscrito que escrevi. Uma mera prosa sáfio para seduzir meus ignorantes leitores a algo que acaba por ignorar a própria ignorância deles e os fazem sentir como se tivessem exaurido os limites do raciocínio."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「比起我写的原稿，你们的剧本更有意思。所以，这份原稿不适合交给贵社。……原本这就是，无聊的原稿。蒙昧无知的读者，无论怎么将之束之高阁，也只是诱导读者认为自身的推理已经到了尽头的烂文。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Questo vostro schema è di gran lunga più interessante del manoscritto che ho composto. In questo caso, non sarebbe adatto consegnarvelo. ... È sempre stata una storia senza valore. Semplicemente qualcosa che i miei lettori ignoranti metterebbero sui loro scaffali e che farebbe credere loro che sono riusciti a risolvere un grandioso enigma.

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Steam (ST): I was hoping that you children of men would recognize the irony and laugh at your own mistake, but it looks like you've taken it seriously. Yes, I can say I'm ashamed at my own failure as a writer."
Umineko Project (UP): "I was hoping that they'd recognize the irony and laugh at their own foolishness, but it looks like you've taken it seriously. Yes, I can say I'm ashamed at my own failure as a writer."

PC Japanese (JP): それを皮肉と気付き、人の子が自らの愚かさに苦笑する、そんな作品に書いたつもりが、まさか推理小説の扱いを受けるとは。我ながら文才のなさに呆れ果てるというものです。」

It's estimated that thousands of manuscripts will be sent in for your contest. If you manage to pick out mine from the pack, and if you also find it deserving of the prize, then I would be happy to continue our discussion just now. .........How does that sound?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I cannot give you this manuscript, but why don't I write up a new one for your company's contest? However, I won't write it under my name. It's estimated that thousands of manuscripts will be sent in for your contest. If you manage to pick out mine from the pack, and if you also find it deserving of the prize, then I would be happy to continue our discussion just now. ......How does that sound?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「この原稿は預けませんが、御社大賞用に新しい原稿を執筆しましょう。ただし、私の名前では描きません。御社大賞の推定投稿数は千件以上。その中から私の匿名原稿を見事見付け出し、その上で尚、大賞に相応しいと思えたなら、その時、改めて先々の話をうかがいましょう。………それで如何か？」
Russian (RU): "Я не могу отдать вам эту рукопись, но почему бы мне не написать для конкурса вашей компании новую? Только я не стану писать её под своим именем. Считается, что на ваш конкурс будут отправлены тысячи рукописей. Если вам удастся вытянуть из них мою и если вы посчитаете её достойной приза, я буду рада продолжить наш разговор. ......Что скажете?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu não posso dar a você este manuscrito, mas que tal eu escrever algo novo para o concurso da sua editora? Contudo, não assinarei com meu nome. É estimado que milhares de manuscritos serão enviados ao seu concurso. Se conseguir encontrar o meu dentre eles, e também achar que ele merece o prêmio, então eu ficaria feliz em continuar nossa conversa agora. .........Que tal?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這份原稿不會給你們，但是我會為貴社的大獎寫份新的原稿。不過，我不會寫名字。貴社的大獎預計投稿數在千份以上。在那其中能夠找到我的匿名原稿，並在此之上，認為那和大獎相符的話，那時，就重新再談之後的事吧？………這樣如何？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这份原稿不会给你们，但是我会为贵社的大奖写份新的原稿。不过，我不会写名字。贵社的大奖预计投稿数在千份以上。在那其中能够找到我的匿名原稿，并在此之上，认为那和大奖相符的话，那时，就重新再谈之后的事吧？………这样如何？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non vi posso donare questo manoscritto, ma perché non scriverne uno nuovo per il concorso della vostra compagnia? Tuttavia, non lo scriverò con il mio nome. Si stima che per il vostro concorso verranno inviati migliaia di manoscritti. Se riuscirete a trovare il mio nel pacco, e se troverete anche che si meriti il premio, allora sarei lieta di continuare la nostra discussione in questo momento. ... Come vi sembra?"

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Steam (ST): "You people truly are amusing, fawning and cringing all the time. But I've grown weary of this for today. Leave now. Meeting with children of men can be so tiring."

Steam (ST): ""Haha--!! We are deeply grateful for your kindness in allowing us this meeting!!!""

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "You're right. "Knowing" often changes how a person lives her life. ...In that case, I have one hope as her blood relative. I hope that, at the end of my game, Ange finds a better way to live her life."
Umineko Project (UP): "You're right. Knowing certain things often changes the way a person lives her life. ......In that case, I have one hope as her blood relative. I hope that, at the end of my game, Ange finds a better way to live her life."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだな。人は知ることで、どう生きるかを変えることもあるだろう。……ならば、俺は肉親として願う。縁寿が、俺のゲームの末に、より良い生き方に人生を変えてくれることをな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだな。人は知ることで、どう生きるかを変えることもあるだろう。……ならば、俺は肉親として願う。縁寿が、俺のゲームの末に、より良い生き方に人生を変えてくれることをな」
Russian (RU): "Ты права. Знание определённых вещей часто меняет то, как человек проживает свою жизнь. ......В таком случае, как её кровный родственник, я надеюсь только на одно. Надеюсь, что под конец моей игры Энджи найдёт лучший способ прожить свою жизнь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Tem razão. Saber certas coisas muitas vezes muda a forma como uma pessoa vive a sua vida. ......Nesse caso, compartilhando do mesmo sangue que ela, eu tenho uma esperança. Eu espero que, ao final do meu jogo, a Ange encontre uma forma melhor de viver a sua vida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊。人通過知道的事，是會改變生活方法的。……那麼，我作為骨肉同胞許願。願緣壽能在我的遊戲結束後，能以更好的生活方式品味人生。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊。人通过知道的事，是会改变生活方法的。……那么，我作为骨肉同胞许愿。愿缘寿能在我的游戏结束后，能以更好的生活方式品味人生。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hai ragione. Conoscere alcune cose spesso cambia il modo in cui una persona vive la sua vita. ... In quel caso, ho una speranza come suo consanguineo. {n}Spero che, alla fine del mio gioco, Ange scopra un modo migliore di vivere la sua vita."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): ""Knowing" may change how people live, but not always in a good direction. There are plenty of things in this world that you'd be more comfortable not knowing."
Umineko Project (UP): "By learning things, people change the way they live, but not always in a good direction. There are plenty of things in this world that you'll be more comfortable not knowing."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「知ることで、人の生き方は変わりますが、それが良いものになるかは分かりかねます。世の中には、知らない方が快適なこともたくさんありますので。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「知ることで、人の生き方は変わりますが、それが良いものになるかは分かりかねます。世の中には、知らない方が快適なこともたくさんありますので」
Russian (RU): "Узнавая что‐то, люди меняют свою жизнь, но не всегда в хорошем направлении. В этом мире есть много того, о чём удобнее не знать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ao aprender as coisas, as pessoas mudam a forma como vivem, mas nem sempre é para uma boa direção. Há diversas coisas neste mundo as quais você ficará mais confortável sem saber."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「由知道的事，人會改變生活方式，但無法知道是否就會變好。因為在這世間，不知道的人會比較舒服的情況有很多。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「由知道的事，人会改变生活方式，但无法知道是否就会变好。因为在这世间，不知道的人会比较舒服的情况有很多。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Apprendendo le cose, le persone cambiano il modo in cui vivono, ma non sempre in modo positivo. Ci sono un sacco di cose in questo mondo che ti farebbero stare meglio non conoscendole."

Steam (ST): "The number of ticks living in the seats on a train. Those urban legends about nasty stuff in the tap water. The world's full of things you'd be better off not knowing...!!"

Russian (RU): "Количество клещей в сиденьях поезда. Те городские легенды о всякой мерзости в водопроводной воде. В мире полно того, о чём лучше не знать!.."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Il numero di zecche sui sedili dei treni. Quelle leggende metropolitane sulle strane sostanze nell'acqua in bottiglia. Il mondo è pieno di cose che faresti meglio a non conoscere...!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "The Book of the Single Truth probably can teach Ange what happened on this island. But what's the point of her knowing that?! It'll just increase the sadness she's felt for 12 years! How many more years will it take for her to find happiness as an ordinary girl...?! How many years will it take for her wounds to be healed...?!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "The Book of the Single Truth probably can teach Ange what happened on this island. But what's the point in her knowing that?! It'll just increase the sadness she's felt for twelve years! How many more years will it take for her to find happiness as an ordinary girl...?! How many years will it take for her wounds to be healed...?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The Book of the Single Truth probably can teach Ange what happened on this island. But what's the point in her knowing that?! It'll just increase the sadness she's felt for 12 years! How many more years will it take for her to find happiness as an ordinary girl...?! How many years will it take for her wounds to be healed...?!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「一なる真実の書は、確かにこの島で何があったのかを縁寿に教えるだろう。しかし、それを知って何の意味がある？！　１２年前の悲しみが増すばかりじゃねぇか！　一体、縁寿は、さらにあと何年を掛ければ１人の女の子としての幸せを享受できるってんだよ…！　一体、何年を掛ければその傷口は癒されるんだよ…！！」
Russian (RU): "Даже если книга единственной правды может рассказать Энджи о произошедшем на острове, зачем ей узнавать?! Это только усилит печаль, которую она испытывала на протяжении 12 лет! Сколько ещё лет ей понадобится, чтобы обрести счастье, как обычной девушке?! Сколько ещё лет уйдёт на исцеление её ран?!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O Livro da Única Verdade provavelmente pode ensinar a ela o que aconteceu nesta ilha. Mas qual o sentido dela saber isso?! Só vai aumentar a tristeza que ela sentiu durante esses doze anos! Quantos anos mais vai levar para ela encontrar a felicidade como uma garota normal...?! Quantos anos mais vai levar até que suas feridas sejam curadas...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「唯一真實之書，的確能夠告訴緣壽這座島上發生過什麼。但是，知道又有什麼意義？！只會增加 12 年前的悲傷啊！到底，緣壽還要再過多少年，才能享受到作為一個女孩子應當享受的幸福…！到底，要過多少年她的傷口才能癒合得了啊…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「唯一真实之书，的确能够告诉缘寿这座岛上发生过什么。但是，知道又有什么意义？！只会增加 12 年前的悲伤啊！到底，缘寿还要再过多少年，才能享受到作为一个女孩子应当享受的幸福…！到底，要过多少年她的伤口才能愈合得了啊…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Il Libro dell'Unica Verità probabilmente può insegnare ad Ange cos'è accaduto su quest'isola. Ma che ragione c'è di saperlo?! Semplicemente aumenterà la tristezza che ha provato per dodici anni! Quanti anni le serviranno ancora per trovare la felicità come una ragazza normale...?! Quanti anni le ci vorranno perché le sue ferite guariscano...?!!"

Russian (RU): "Узнав правду, тебе лишь придётся принять смерти своей семьи!.. Разве ты не хотела жить, надеясь, что кто‐нибудь из них мог чудом выжить и что однажды тебе может представиться шанс увидеть их снова?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se aprender a verdade, você terá que aceitar a morte da sua família...! Você nunca pensou sobre continuar vivendo, esperando que, por milagre, alguém possa ter sobrevivido? E que, algum dia, você pode ter a chance de ver essa pessoa de novo...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「知道真實的話，的確是要接受家人的死…！但汝就不認為，說不定會有家人中有誰活了下來這樣的奇跡，為了和那人再會而活下去嗎…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「知道真实的话，的确是要接受家人的死…！但汝就不认为，说不定会有家人中有谁活了下来这样的奇迹，为了和那人再会而活下去吗…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Se scopri la verità, dovrai solo accettare la morte della tua famiglia...! Non hai mai pensato a continuare a vivere, sperando che per un qualche miracolo, uno di loro potesse essere sopravvissuto? E che un giorno, potresti avere l'occasione di rivederlo...?!"

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "I'm not worried about that. Even the Witch of Miracles couldn't find a Fragment like that."
Umineko Project (UP): "Don't worry. Even the Witch of Miracles couldn't find a fragment like that."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I'm not worried about that. Even the Witch of Miracles couldn't find a Fragment like that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「安心して。奇跡の魔女でさえ、そのカケラを見つけられなかったから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「安心して。奇跡の魔女でさえ、そのカケラを見つけられなかったから」
Russian (RU): "Мне всё равно. Даже ведьма чудес не смогла найти такой фрагмент."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não se preocupe. Nem a Bruxa dos Milagres conseguiu achar um Fragmento assim."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「放心吧？就連奇跡的魔女，都沒能找到那樣的碎片。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「放心吧？就连奇迹的魔女，都没能找到那样的碎片。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non me ne preoccupo. Persino la Strega dei Miracoli non è riuscita a trovare un Frammento del genere."

Steam (ST): In the Great Rokkenjima Explosion, almost none of the family's remains were recovered.
Umineko Project (UP): Almost none of the family's remains were recovered from the Great Rokkenjima Explosion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the Great Rokkenjima Explosion, almost none of the family's remains were recovered.
PC Japanese (JP): 六軒島の大爆発で、親族の遺体はほとんど発見されなかった。
Russian (RU): После взрыва на Роккенджиме почти ничьи останки не обнаружили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Praticamente nada dos restos da família foi recuperado depois da Grande Explosão de Rokkenjima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為六軒島的大爆炸，親族們的遺體幾乎都沒被發現。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为六轩岛的大爆炸，亲族们的遗体几乎都没被发现。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nella Grande Esplosione di Rokkenjima, non fu ritrovata quasi nessuna traccia della famiglia.

Steam (ST): Some days, ...I hoped that this might be a sign that they had escaped the explosion and survived. That hope gave me the strength to live on.
Umineko Project (UP): Some days, ......I hoped that this might be a sign that they had escaped the explosion and survived......and that hope gave me the strength to live on.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Some days, ......I hoped that this might be a sign that they had escaped the explosion and survived. That hope gave me the strength to live on.
PC Japanese (JP): それはひょっとしたら、……爆発を逃れて生き残ったことを示すのかもしれないと、それを生きる糧にした日もあった。
Russian (RU): Иногда...... я надеялась, что это может указывать на то, что они избежали взрыва и выжили. Эта надежда дала мне силу жить дальше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certos dias, ......eu desejava que isso pudesse ser um sinal de que tinham escapado da explosão e sobrevivido......e essa esperança me dava forças para continuar vivendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我也曾有過，……這說不定代表著有人從那爆炸中活了下來，並將之作為活下去的精神食糧的日子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我也曾有过，……这说不定代表着有人从那爆炸中活了下来，并将之作为活下去的精神食粮的日子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Certi giorni... sperai che questo potesse essere un segno che potrebbero essere scampati all'esplosione ed essere sopravvissuti. Quella speranza mi diede la forza per continuare a vivere.

Steam (ST): However, that hope wasn't strong enough to support me for 12 long years.
Umineko Project (UP): However, that hope wasn't strong enough to support me for twelve long years.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, that hope wasn't strong enough to support me for 12 long years.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それだけを糧にするには、１２年は長過ぎる。
Russian (RU): Но она не была достаточно сильной для того, чтобы поддерживать меня долгие 12 лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas essa esperança não foi forte o bastante para me dar suporte durante aqueles longos doze anos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，無論有怎樣的精神食糧，要度過 12 年也太漫長了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，无论有怎样的精神食粮，要度过 12 年也太漫长了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, quella speranza non fu abbastanza forte da supportarmi per 12 lunghi anni.

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "So, even though I wanted to know the truth, I unconsciously averted my eyes. ...I felt that learning of my family's deaths for certain would force me to deny any possibility of someone miraculously surviving.
Umineko Project (UP): "So, even though I wanted to know the truth, I was unconsciously averting my eyes. ......I felt that learning of my family's deaths for certain would force me to deny any possibility of someone miraculously surviving."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So, even though I wanted to know the truth, I was unconsciously averting my eyes. ......I felt that learning of my family's deaths for certain would force me to deny any possibility of someone miraculously surviving.
PC Japanese (JP): 「だから私は、真実を知りたいと思いながらも無意識の内に、真実から目を背けていた。……家族の死をはっきりと理解することで、誰かが生き残ったかもしれないという奇跡を、自ら否定してしまいそうで。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だから私は、真実を知りたいと思いながらも無意識の内に、真実から目を背けていた。……家族の死をはっきりと理解することで、誰かが生き残ったかもしれないという奇跡を、自ら否定してしまいそうで」
Russian (RU): "Поэтому даже несмотря на желание узнать правду, я невольно отводила взгляд. ......Мне казалось, что если я узнаю о смертях своей семьи, мне наверняка придётся опровергнуть любую возможность того, что кто‐нибудь чудом выжил."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Por isso, mesmo que eu quisesse saber a verdade, eu estava desviando meu olhar inconscientemente. ......Eu sentia que aprender sobre a morte da família iria me forçar a negar qualquer possibilidade de que alguém tivesse sobrevivido milagrosamente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「所以我雖然想要知道真實，卻也在無意識中逃避著真實。……因為清楚地理解家人的死，就會自己否認掉說不定有人生還的奇跡。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「所以我虽然想要知道真实，却也在无意识中逃避着真实。……因为清楚地理解家人的死，就会自己否认掉说不定有人生还的奇迹。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quindi, anche se volevo sapere la verità, stavo inconsciamente distogliendo lo sguardo da essa. ... Sentì che sapere della morte certa della mia famiglia mi avrebbe forzato a negare qualsiasi possibilità di qualcuno miracolosamente sopravvissuto.

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): ...But I'm tired of living on and on, with nothing but that impossible hope of a miracle to keep me going.
Umineko Project (UP): ".........But I'm tired of living on and on, with nothing but that impossible hope of a miracle to keep me going."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But I'm tired of living on and on, with nothing but that impossible hope of a miracle to keep me going.
PC Japanese (JP): ………でもね、もうそういう、ありもしない奇跡にすがって生き延びるのには飽き飽きしたの。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………でもね、もうそういう、ありもしない奇跡にすがって生き延びるのには飽き飽きしたの」
Russian (RU): "......Но я устала жить с одной лишь невозможной надеждой на чудо, ведущей меня."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Mas eu estou cansada de continuar vivendo com nada além dessa esperança impossível de um milagre para me fazer continuar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………但是啊，我已經完全厭倦再依靠這種不可能存在的奇跡苟延殘喘了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………但是啊，我已经完全厌倦再依靠这种不可能存在的奇迹苟延残喘了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma sono stanca di continuare a vivere, con niente eccetto quell'impossibile speranza di un miracolo a farmi forza.

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): That's why I decided to accept my family's deaths. I decided to accept the truth, no matter what it is. That's why I became a Witch of Truth...!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "That's why I decided to accept my family's deaths. I decided to accept the truth, no matter what it is. That's why I became a Witch of Truth...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's why I decided to accept my family's deaths. I decided to accept the truth, no matter what it is. That's why I became a Witch of Truth...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): だから、私は家族の死を受け入れることにした。どのような真実であろうとも認めようと思った。だから、私は真実の魔女となった…！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だから、私は家族の死を受け入れることにした。どのような真実であろうとも認めようと思った。だから、私は真実の魔女となった…！！」
Russian (RU): "Вот почему я решила принять смерти своей семьи. Я решила принять правду, какой бы она ни была. Именно поэтому я стала ведьмой правды!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É por isso que eu decidi aceitar a morte da minha família. Eu decidi aceitar a verdade, independente do que ela for. É por isso que eu me tornei uma Bruxa da Verdade...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「所以，我選擇接受家人的死。無論真實是怎樣的都會去接受。所以，我才成為了真實的魔女…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「所以，我选择接受家人的死。无论真实是怎样的都会去接受。所以，我才成为了真实的魔女…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ecco perché ho deciso di accettare la morte della mia famiglia. Ho deciso di accettare la verità, non importa quale sia. Ecco perché sono diventata una Strega della Verità...!!"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...How foolish, to be blinded by the truth of the past and unable to see one's own future...! Forgive me, Battler. ...I was not strong enough to guide your sister properly..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......How foolish, to be blinded by the truth of the past and unable to see one's own future......! Forgive me, Battler. ......I was not strong enough to guide your sister to a proper future..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……過去の真実に目が眩み、自らの未来が見えなくなった者の、何と愚かなことか……！　許せ、戦人。……そなたの妹を、正しき未来に導くには、妾は力が足りなかった…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……過去の真実に目が眩み、自らの未来が見えなくなった者の、何と愚かなことか……！　許せ、戦人。……そなたの妹を、正しき未来に導くには、妾は力が足りなかった…」
Russian (RU): "......Как глупо зацикливаться на правде прошлого и не видеть своё будущее!.. Прости, Баттлер. ......Моих сил не хватило, чтобы направить твою сестру к правильному будущему..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Quanta tolice, a ponto de ser cega pela verdade do passado e incapaz de ver o próprio futuro......! Me perdoe, Battler. ......Eu não fui forte o bastante para guiar sua irmã para o futuro certo..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……因為過去的真實而失去判斷力，讓自己看不到未來的人，是何等的愚蠢……！原諒妾身，戰人。……妾身的力量還不足以，將汝的妹妹引導到正確的未來上去…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……因为过去的真实而失去判断力，让自己看不到未来的人，是何等的愚蠢……！原谅妾身，战人。……妾身的力量还不足以，将汝的妹妹引导到正确的未来上去…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Che sciocchezza, essere accecati dalla verità del passato incapaci di vedere il proprio futuro...! Perdonami, Battler. ... Non sono stata abbastanza forte da guidare tua Sorella a un futuro adatto..."

Steam (ST): A blazing blue wedge appeared in Ange's hand. It was long, thick, and shaped like a spear.
Umineko Project (UP): A blazing blue wedge appeared in Ange's hand.{n}It was long, thick, and shaped like a spear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A blazing blue wedge appeared in Ange's hand. It was long, thick, and shaped like a spear.
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿の手に、青く眩しく光る楔が現れる。それは太く長く、まるで槍のように見えた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 縁寿の手に、青く眩しく光る楔が現れる。{n}それは太く長く、まるで槍のように見えた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma resplandecente cunha azul surgiu nas mãos de Ange.{n}Era longa, espessa e tinha a forma de uma lança.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿的手中，出现了闪着炫目蓝色光芒的楔子。{n}那又粗又长，仿佛像长枪一般。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Un ardente cuneo blu apparse nella mano di Ange. Era lungo, spesso, e dalla forma di una lancia.

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "This is the end, witch of 1986. ...{p:2:This closed room is perfect!! Therefore, I can't get out, and you can't lay a finger on me from the outside! However, you "locked me into this room"! So, we can say you killed me with this simple trick...!! You shut me in this perfect closed room and made me starve to death...!! Since you intentionally did this, it's totally fair to say "This is a closed room murder with you as the killer"!!}
Umineko Project (UP): "This is the end, witch of 1986. ......{p:2:This locked room is perfect!! Therefore, I can't get out, and you can't lay a finger on me from the outside! However, you {i:locked me into} this room! And there's just one trick that makes that the same as you "killing" me...!! You shut me in this perfect locked room and made me starve to death...!! Since you intentionally did this, there's no problem saying that this was a locked room murder with you as the killer}!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "This is the end, witch of 1986. ......{p:2:This closed room is perfect!! Therefore, I can't get out, and you can't lay a finger on me from the outside! However, you 'locked me into this room'! So, we can say you killed me with this simple trick...!! You shut me in this perfect closed room and made me starve to death...!! Since you intentionally did this, there's no problem saying that 'this was a closed room murder with you as the killer'!!}
PC Japanese (JP): 「これで終わりよ、１９８６年の魔女。……{p:2:この密室は完璧な密室！！ゆえに私は出られず、あんただって外部から私に指一本触れることは出来ない！でも、あんたは私をこの密室に“閉じ込めた”わ！それを以って、私を“殺した”と言える唯一のトリックがこれよ…！！あんたは私をこの完全な密室に閉じ込めて餓死させた…！！それを目論んで私を閉じ込めたなら、これは立派に“あんたが殺したことになる密室殺人”！！}
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「これで終わりよ、１９８６年の魔女。……{p:2:この密室は完璧な密室！！　ゆえに私は出られず、あんただって外部から私に指一本触れることは出来ない！　でも、あんたは私をこの密室に“閉じ込めた”わ！　それを以って、私を“殺した”と言える唯一のトリックがこれよ…！！　あんたは私をこの完全な密室に閉じ込めて餓死させた…！！　それを目論んで私を閉じ込めたなら、これは立派に“あんたが殺したことになる密室殺人”！！}」
Russian (RU): "Вот и всё, ведьма 1986. ......{p:2:Эта закрытая комната идеальна! Поэтому я не могу выйти, а ты снаружи не можешь добраться до меня! Но ты {i:заперла меня} в этой комнате! И можно сказать, что ты убила меня этой простой хитростью!.. Ты заперла меня в этой идеальной закрытой комнате и заставила умереть с голоду!.. Ты сделала так намеренно, поэтому это правильное «убийство в закрытой комнате, где убийцей была ты»}!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Esse é o fim, bruxa de 1986. ......{p:2:Este quarto fechado é perfeito!! Portanto, eu não posso sair, e você não pode encostar um dedo em mim pelo lado de fora! Mas você {i:me trancou} neste quarto! E há apenas um único truque que faz o mesmo que você me "matar"...!! Você me trancou neste quarto fechado perfeito e me fez morrer de fome...!! Como você fez isso intencionalmente, não existe nenhum problema em dizer que esse é um assassinato de quarto fechado onde você é a assassina}!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這樣就結束了，1986 年的魔女。……{p:2:這個密室是完美的密室！！所以我出不去，你從外面也碰不到我一根汗毛！但是，你把我“關在了”這個密室裡！由此，這就是唯一可以說是把我“殺死”的手法…！！你把我關入這個完美的密室裡餓死我…！！因為是你策劃把我關進來的，這就是完美的“由你殺死我的密室殺人”！！}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这样就结束了，1986 年的魔女。……{p:2:这个密室是完美的密室！！所以我出不去，你从外面也碰不到我一根汗毛！但是，你把我“关在了”这个密室里！由此，这就是唯一可以说是把我“杀死”的手法…！！你把我关入这个完美的密室里饿死我…！！因为是你策划把我关进来的，这就是完美的“由你杀死我的密室杀人”！！}」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Questa è la fine, strega del 1986. ... {p:2:Questa stanza chiusa è perfetta!!} {p:2:Perciò, io non posso uscire, e tu non puoi alzare un dito su di me dall'esterno!} {p:2:Tuttavia, mi hai ‘chiuso in questa stanza’!} {p:2:Quindi, possiamo dire che mi hai ucciso con questo semplice trucco...!!} {p:2:Mi hai rinchiuso in questa stanza chiusa perfetta e mi hai fatto morire di fame...!!} {p:2:Dato che hai fatto ciò intenzionalmente, non c'è problema nel dire che ‘questo era un omicidio con una stanza chiusa con te come assassina’!!}

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): It looks like being overly vague with the cause of death backfired on you. ......So long, witch of illusions. <See you in hell>."
Umineko Project (UP): "It looks like being overly vague with the cause of death backfired on you. .........So long, witch of illusions. <See you in hell>."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It looks like being overly vague with the cause of death backfired on you. .........So long, witch of illusions. <See you in hell>."
PC Japanese (JP): 死因を煙に巻きすぎたのが裏目に出たわね。………さようなら、幻想の魔女。シーユーヘル。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「死因を煙に巻きすぎたのが裏目に出たわね。………さようなら、幻想の魔女。シーユーヘル」
Russian (RU): "Чрезмерная расплывчатость с причиной смерти обернулась против тебя. .........Прощай, ведьма иллюзий. See you in hell."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Parece que ser vaga demais com a causa da morte acabou se voltando contra você. .........Adeus, bruxa das ilusões. {i:See you in hell}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「給死因打了太多煙霧彈反而露出了破綻呢。………再見了，幻想的魔女。See you hell.」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「给死因打了太多烟雾弹反而露出了破绽呢。………再见了，幻想的魔女。See you hell.」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembra che essere eccessivamente vaghi con le cause della morte ti si sia ritorto contro. ... Addio, strega delle illusioni. {p:0:＜}See you in hell{p:0:＞}."

Steam (ST): With the stained glass window behind her, Beato spread her arms and let the spear of the blue truth pierce her.
Umineko Project (UP): With the stained glass window behind her, Beato spread her arms and let the spear of the blue truth pierce her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): その青き真実の槍を、ステンドグラスを背負って浮かぶベアトは両腕を広げて受け入れる。
Russian (RU): Стоя перед витражом, Беато развела руки и дала копью синей правды пронзить её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com o vitral às suas costas, Beato abriu seus braços e recebeu a lança da verdade azul em seu peito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 背對著彩繪玻璃浮在空中的貝阿朵，伸開雙臂接受那藍色真實之槍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 背对着彩绘玻璃浮在空中的贝阿朵，伸开双臂接受那蓝色真实之枪。

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ゲームセット。…これが絵羽伯母さんの日記、……一なる真実の書ね」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{i:Game set}. ...Este é o diário da Tia Eva, ......o Livro da Única Verdade."

Umineko Project (UP): Ange picked the book up from where it lay on the altar, sealed in crystal.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange pegou o livro de onde ele descansava sobre o altar, selado no cristal.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿将放在祭坛上的，被水晶封印着的那个拿在手上。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...If you read that, then by your contract with {f:5:Bernkastel}, you will die... ...Learning the truth just to die? Ridiculous...!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "......If you read that, then by your contract with {f:5:Bernkastel}, you will die... .........Learning the truth just to die? Ridiculous...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......If you read that, then by your contract with Bernkastel, you will die... ......Learning the truth just to die? Ridiculous...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……それを読めば、そなたはベルンカステルとの契約により、死ぬのであろうが…。………死ぬために真実を知るのか？　馬鹿げている…！！」
Russian (RU): "......Прочитав её, согласно твоему договору с {f:5:Бернкастель}, ты умрёшь... ......Узнать правду просто чтобы умереть? Чушь!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Se o lê‐lo, devido ao seu contrato com {f:5:Bernkastel}, você morrerá... .........Aprender a verdade para simplesmente morrer? Ridículo...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……讀了它的話，汝就會因與貝倫卡斯泰露定下的契約而死吧…？………為了去死而知道真實嗎？簡直是瘋了…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……读了它的话，汝就会因与贝伦卡斯泰露定下的契约而死吧…？………为了去死而知道真实吗？简直是疯了…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Se lo leggi, allora per il tuo contratto con Bernkastel, morirai... scoprire la verità solo per morire? Ridicolo...!!"

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "That's right. I'm looking for the truth so I can die. ...At least let me choose how I go. ...I'm not an idiot. ...I know the real me is still floating in that starry sky."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right. I'm looking for the truth so I can die. ......At least let me choose how I go. .........I'm not an idiot. ......I know the real me is still.........floating in that starry sky."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's right. I'm looking for the truth so I can die. ......At least let me choose how I go. ......I'm not an idiot. ......I know the real me is still floating in that starry sky."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうよ。私は死ぬために真実を求めてるの。……死に方くらい、私に選ばせて。………私も馬鹿じゃない。……本当の私はきっと、………あの、地上の星空の宙に、浮かんでいるのよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうよ。私は死ぬために真実を求めてるの。……死に方くらい、私に選ばせて。………私も馬鹿じゃない。……本当の私はきっと、………あの、地上の星空の宙に、浮かんでいるのよ」
Russian (RU): "Верно. Я ищу правду для того, чтобы умереть. ......Дайте хоть самой выбрать, как. ......Я не идиотка. ......Я знаю, что настоящая я всё ещё парит в том звёздном небе."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Tem razão. Eu estou procurando a verdade para poder morrer. ......Ao menos me deixe escolher como será. .........Eu não sou idiota. ......Eu sei que a verdadeira eu ainda.........está flutuando naquele céu estrelado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊。我就是為了去死而追求真實的。……死法至少讓我自己來選擇。………我也不是笨蛋。……真正的我一定，………還浮在那個，地上的星空的空中。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊。我就是为了去死而追求真实的。……死法至少让我自己来选择。………我也不是笨蛋。……真正的我一定，………还浮在那个，地上的星空的空中。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È così. Sto cercando la verità così che possa morire. ... Fammi almeno scegliere come andarmene. ... Non sono un'idiota. ... So che la vera me sta ancora fluttuando in quel cielo stellato."

Steam (ST): {f:5:Bernkastel} acknowledged me as the final {f:5:Beatrice} and invited me on a journey to learn the truth of 1986.
Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Bernkastel} acknowledged me as the final {f:5:Beatrice} and invited me on a journey to learn the truth of 1986.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Bernkastel acknowledged me as the final Beatrice and invited me on a journey to learn the truth of 1986.
PC Japanese (JP): ベルンカステルは、私を最後のベアトリーチェだと認め、１９８６年の真実を知る旅に私を招いた。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Бернкастель} признала меня последней {f:5:Беатриче} и пригласила в путешествие к правде 1986.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A {f:5:Bernkastel} me reconheceu como a última {f:5:Beatrice} e me convidou a uma jornada para aprender a verdade sobre 1986.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝倫卡斯泰露，認同我為最後的貝阿朵莉切，將我招待至獲知 1986 年的真實之旅。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝伦卡斯泰露，认同我为最后的贝阿朵莉切，将我招待至获知 1986 年的真实之旅。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Bernkastel mi ha riconosciuto come l'ultima Beatrice e mi ha invitato in un viaggio per scoprire la verità del 1986.

Steam (ST): I won't be able to return here again.
Umineko Project (UP): There would be no coming back from that journey.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I won't be able to return here again.
PC Japanese (JP): ここには二度と戻って来られない。
Russian (RU): Я больше не смогу вернуться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não haveria retorno dessa jornada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 無法再回到這裡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 无法再回到这里了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non potrò ritornare qui di nuovo.

Steam (ST): When {f:5:Bernkastel} told me that and walked off the roof into the black sky, ...I followed her into the empty air.
Umineko Project (UP): When {f:5:Bernkastel} told me that and walked off the roof into the black sky, ......I followed her into the empty air.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Bernkastel told me that and walked off the roof into the black sky, ......I followed her into the empty air.
PC Japanese (JP): そう告げて、ビルの屋上から漆黒の中空へ歩み出すベルンカステルの背中を追って、……私も中空へ足を踏み出した。
Russian (RU): Когда {f:5:Бернкастель} сказала мне это и сошла с крыши в ночное небо...... я последовала за ней в пустой воздух.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando ela me disse isso e caminhou além do telhado, na direção do céu azeviche, ......eu a segui sobre o ar vazio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 追在這樣說著，向著大樓上方漆黑的夜空走去的貝倫卡斯泰露身後，……我也向空中踏出了腳步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 追在这样说着，向着大楼上方漆黑的夜空走去的贝伦卡斯泰露身后，……我也向空中踏出了脚步。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando Bernkastel mi ha disse ciò e camminò nel cielo nero... io la seguii nell'aria vuota.

Steam (ST): That was the contract. I wanted two things from {f:5:Bernkastel}.
Umineko Project (UP): That was the contract. I wanted two things from {f:5:Bernkastel}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was the contract. I wanted two things from Bernkastel.
PC Japanese (JP): それが、契約。私はベルンカステルに２つを望んだ。
Russian (RU): Таков был уговор. Я хотела от {f:5:Бернкастель} две вещи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esse foi o contrato. Eu queria duas coisas da {f:5:Bernkastel}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這就是，契約。我向貝倫卡斯泰露提出了兩個願望。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这就是，契约。我向贝伦卡斯泰露提出了两个愿望。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quello era il contratto. Volevo due cose da Bernkastel.

Steam (ST): One was for someone from my family to come back. The other...was revenge.
Umineko Project (UP): One was for someone from my family to come back.{n}The other......was revenge.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): One was for someone from my family to come back. The other......was revenge.
PC Japanese (JP): １つは家族が誰か帰ってきて欲しい。もう１つは、……復讐。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): １つは家族が誰か帰ってきて欲しい。{n}もう１つは、……復讐。
Russian (RU): Первое — чтобы кто‐нибудь из моей семьи вернулся.{n}А второе...... месть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma era que alguém da minha família retornasse.{n}A outra era......vingança.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一個是希望親人中有人能回來。{n}另一個是，……復仇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一个是希望亲人中有人能回来。{n}另一个是，……复仇。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Una era far tornare qualcuno della mia famiglia. L'altra... era vendetta.

Steam (ST): I wanted to destroy the Illusion of the Witch that hid the events of that day. I wanted to reach the truth.
Umineko Project (UP): To destroy the witch illusions concealing the events of that day. In other words, to reach the truth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wanted to destroy the Illusion of the Witch that hid the events of that day. I wanted to reach the truth.
PC Japanese (JP): あの日に何があったのかを覆い隠す、魔女幻想を打ち破るということ。即ち、真実に至るということ。
Russian (RU): Я хотела разрушить иллюзию ведьмы, скрывающую события того дня. Хотела узнать правду.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Destruir a ilusão da bruxa que encobria os acontecimentos daquele dia. Ou seja, alcançar a verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 打破隱藏著那一天發生了什麼的魔女幻想。這即是，抵達真實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 打破隐藏着那一天发生了什么的魔女幻想。这即是，抵达真实。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Volevo distruggere l'Illusione della Strega che aveva nascosto gli eventi di quel giorno. Volevo raggiungere la verità.

Steam (ST): However, the first of my wishes couldn't come true.
Umineko Project (UP): However, the first of my wishes couldn't come true.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the first of my wishes couldn't come true.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、最初の願いは叶えられない。
Russian (RU): Однако моё первое желание не могло сбыться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas o meu primeiro desejo não se concretizou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，第一個願望無法實現。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，第一个愿望无法实现。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, il primo dei miei desideri non poteva avverarsi.

Steam (ST): After all, even the Witch of Miracles couldn't find a Fragment where my family came home.
Umineko Project (UP): After all, even the Witch of Miracles couldn't find a fragment where my family came home.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After all, even the Witch of Miracles couldn't find a Fragment where my family came home.
PC Japanese (JP): だって、奇跡の魔女でさえ、私の家族が帰ってくるというカケラを見つけられなかった。
Russian (RU): Ведь даже ведьма чудес не смогла найти фрагмент, где моя семья вернулась домой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Afinal, nem mesmo a Bruxa dos Milagres conseguiu encontrar um Fragmento no qual a minha família voltava para casa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為，就連奇跡的魔女，也找不到我的家人能回來的碎片。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为，就连奇迹的魔女，也找不到我的家人能回来的碎片。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopotutto, persino la Strega dei Miracoli non è riuscita a trovare un Frammento dove la mia famiglia tornava a casa.

Steam (ST): So, she wordlessly questioned me.
Umineko Project (UP): So, she wordlessly questioned me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, she wordlessly questioned me.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、彼女は無言で私に問い掛けたのだ。
Russian (RU): Поэтому она без слов спросила меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ela me questionou sem usar de palavras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，她無言地對我說。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，她无言地对我说。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, mi interrogò silenziosamente.

Steam (ST): She told me that I couldn't reach the truth unless I had the courage to end this worthless life, where I lived like a ghost, hoping someone might come back.
Umineko Project (UP): She told me that I couldn't reach the truth unless I had the courage to end this worthless life, living like a ghost and hoping someone might come back.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She told me that I couldn't reach the truth unless I had the courage to end this worthless life, living like a ghost and hoping someone might come back.
PC Japanese (JP): 家族の誰かが帰ってくるかもしれないからと、いつまでも亡霊のように生き続ける、この無駄な生を終わらせる勇気を持たない限り、真実には至れないと。
Russian (RU): Она сказала мне, что я не смогу достичь правды, если у меня нет храбрости покончить с никчёмной жизнью призрака, который надеется, что кто‐нибудь может вернуться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela me disse que eu não alcançaria a verdade sem que eu tivesse a coragem necessária para colocar um fim nesta vida sem valor, vivendo como um fantasma e esperando que alguém retornasse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 認為家人中說不定有人會回來，永遠都像亡靈一樣繼續活著，沒有終結這種無用的人生的勇氣的話，就無法抵達真實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 认为家人中说不定有人会回来，永远都像亡灵一样继续活着，没有终结这种无用的人生的勇气的话，就无法抵达真实。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Mi disse che non potevo raggiungere la verità finché non avessi avuto il coraggio di finire quest'inutile vita, vivendo come un fantasma e sperando che qualcuno ritornasse.

Steam (ST): So, she walked out into the open air, and I followed her.
Umineko Project (UP): So, she walked out into the open air, and I followed her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, she walked out into the open air, and I followed her.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、彼女は中空に歩み出し、私にその後を追わせた。
Russian (RU): Поэтому она вышла в открытый воздух, и я последовала за ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim, ela caminhou sobre o ar, e eu a segui.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，她向空中走去，讓我追在後面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，她向空中走去，让我追在后面。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, andò via nell'aria aperta, e io la seguii.

Steam (ST): Yes, now I can understand.
Umineko Project (UP): Yes, now I can understand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Yes, now I can understand.
PC Japanese (JP): そう、今だからこそ理解できる。
Russian (RU): Да, теперь я понимаю.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, agora eu entendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對，到現在我才能夠理解。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对，到现在我才能够理解。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sì, ora riesco a capire.

Steam (ST): When I offered to trade away my life, I made one wish and gave up on another.
Umineko Project (UP): When I offered to trade away my life that day, ......I made one wish and gave up on another.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I offered to trade away my life, I made one wish and gave up on another.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は自らの命と引き換えに、……ベルンカステルにあの日、１つのことを願い、１つのことを諦めたのだ。
Russian (RU): Предложив продать свою жизнь, я загадала одно желание и отказалась от другого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu ofereci trocar a minha vida naquele dia, ......eu fiz um desejo e abri mão de outro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以我自己的性命為交換，……對貝倫卡斯泰露在那一天，許了一個願望，放棄了一個願望。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以我自己的性命为交换，……对贝伦卡斯泰露在那一天，许了一个愿望，放弃了一个愿望。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando ho offerto di sacrificare la mia vita, ho espresso un desiderio e ho rinunciato a un altro.

Steam (ST): I wished for revenge against the illusion hiding the truth.
Umineko Project (UP): I wished for revenge against the illusion that hid the truth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wished for revenge against the illusion that hid the truth.
PC Japanese (JP): 願ったのは、真実を覆い隠す幻想への、復讐。
Russian (RU): Я пожелала отомстить иллюзии, скрывающей правду.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu desejei por vingança contra a ilusão que escondia a verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 許的願是，對掩蓋真實的幻想的，復仇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 许的愿是，对掩盖真实的幻想的，复仇。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Desiderai vendetta verso l'Illusione che nascondeva la verità.

Steam (ST): And now, I've succeeded in that revenge, defeating the master of that illusion and obtaining the Book of the Single Truth.
Umineko Project (UP): And now, I have succeeded in that revenge, defeating the master of that illusion and obtaining the Book of the Single Truth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And now, I have succeeded in that revenge, defeating the master of that illusion and obtaining the Book of the Single Truth.
PC Japanese (JP): そして今こそ私は幻想の主、黄金の魔女を打ち破って一なる真実の書を手に入れ、その復讐を成し遂げた。
Russian (RU): И вот, мне удалась эта месть: я одолела хозяйку этой иллюзии и заполучила книгу единственной правды.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E agora, eu tive sucesso nessa vingança, derrotando a mentora dessa ilusão e obtendo o Livro da Única Verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 並且現在我終於得到了能夠擊敗幻想的主人，黃金的魔女的唯一真實之書，達成復仇的目的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 并且现在我终于得到了能够击败幻想的主人，黄金的魔女的唯一真实之书，达成复仇的目的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E adesso, ho avuto successo in quella vendetta, sconfiggendo la padrona di quell'Illusione e ottenendo il Libro dell'Unica Verità.

Steam (ST): What I gave up was my naivety, my continuing belief that someone from my family might come back.
Umineko Project (UP): What I gave up was my naivety, my continuing belief that someone from my family might come back.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What I gave up was my naivety, my continuing belief that someone from my family might come back.
PC Japanese (JP): 諦めたのは、家族が誰か帰ってくるかもしれないと信じ続ける、甘えた心。
Russian (RU): Я отказалась от своей наивности, от продолжительной веры в то, что кто‐то из моей семьи может вернуться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquilo que eu abri mão foi a minha ingenuidade, minha crença contínua de que alguém da minha família ainda poderia retornar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 放棄的是，繼續相信家人中說不定會有人回來的，天真的心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 放弃的是，继续相信家人中说不定会有人回来的，天真的心。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ciò a cui ho rinunciato era la mia ingenuità, la mia continua convinzione che qualcuno della mia famiglia potesse tornare indietro.

Steam (ST): And now, I can accept that my entire family is dead.

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...Can you make someone alive just because no one knows any different? These cat boxes you talk about are just naive delusions. The idea that a corpse can live as long as you keep it hidden! But even if you hide a corpse, it's still dead...!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "......How can you say someone's alive just because you don't know? This cat box of yours is just a naive illusion, the idea that hiding a corpse means you can pretend it might still be alive! But even if you hide a corpse, it's still dead...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......How can you live without knowing the truth? This cat box of yours is just a naive illusion. The idea that hiding a corpse means it might still be alive! But even if you hide a corpse, it's still dead...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……知らなきゃ生きてることに出来るの？　あんたたちの言う猫箱というのは、死体を隠せば生きていることにしてもいいという、甘えた妄想だけがたった一つのトリック！　でもね、隠したって、死んでいることは変わらないのよ…！！」
Russian (RU): "......Как можно жить, не зная правды? Ваша кошачья коробка всего лишь наивная иллюзия, говорящая, что раз трупов нет, они ещё могут быть живы! Но даже если трупы не найдены, они всё равно мертвы!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Como você pode dizer que alguém está vivo só porque não sabe? Essa sua caixa de gato não passa de uma ingênua ilusão, o pensamento de que esconder um corpo significa que você ainda pode fingir que o mesmo está vivo! Mas mesmo que esconda o cadáver, ele continua morto...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……不知道的話也能活著嗎？你們所言的所謂貓箱，不過是隱藏了屍體就可以讓人繼續活著的天真的妄想，也是唯一的詭計！但是啊，就算隱藏了，也無法改變已經死了的事實…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……不知道的话也能活着吗？你们所言的所谓猫箱，不过是隐藏了尸体就可以让人继续活着的天真的妄想，也是唯一的诡计！但是啊，就算隐藏了，也无法改变已经死了的事实…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Come puoi vivere senza conoscere la verità? Questa tua scatola del gatto è solo un'ingenua illusione. L'idea che nascondere un corpo significhi che è ancora vivo! Ma anche se nascondi un corpo, è sempre morto...!!"

Speaker: {f:5:Ange Beatrice}

I'll free myself from that life as a ghost, waiting for a miracle that'll never happen! I'll end my life as a noble martyr who's reached the truth...!!"

Colocarei um fim a minha vida, como um nobre mártir que alcançou a verdade...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你們真的認為，在遙遠的天國永遠守護你這樣的，童話一般的話就能堵住我的傷口嗎？！我是真實的魔女，安琪·貝阿朵莉切！！我已經從等待不會發生的奇跡而如亡靈一般活著，變成了選擇作為抵達真實的高潔的殉教者結束生命…！！」

Steam (ST): "Yes. All truths in this world are meaningless. Anche quando c'è un'Unica Verità, può significare cose diverse per persone diverse! La verità stessa non significa niente! C'è solo una ragione per cui io sono ancora interessata alla verità nonostante tutto!"

Steam (ST): "So long, Battler-san...!! Even if this has been my only time to shine! Even if I've outlived my usefulness and am about to be thrown back into the depths of oblivion! Even so, I have no regrets!!"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So long, Battler-san...!! Even if this has been my only time to shine! Even if I've outlived my usefulness and am about to be thrown back into the depths of oblivion! Even so, I have no regrets!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「御機嫌よう、戦人さん…！！　私の出番がこれだけだとしても！　これで私が用済みで、再び忘却の深遠に突き落とされようとも！　悔いのない時間でした！！」
Russian (RU): "До встречи, Баттлер!.. Хотя я только сейчас могла проявить себя! Хотя я пережила свою полезность, и меня вот‐вот бросят обратно в глубины забвения! Я не жалею!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Passar bem, Battler‐san...!! Mesmo que esse tenha sido meu único momento de glória! Mesmo que eu tenha servido ao meu propósito e esteja prestes a ser jogada de volta às profundezas do esquecimento! Mesmo assim, eu não tenho arrependimentos!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「貴安，戰人先生…！！就算我的戲份到此為止！就算我沒用了，再次被打入忘卻的深淵！這也是不會令人後悔的時間！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「贵安，战人先生…！！就算我的戏份到此为止！就算我没用了，再次被打入忘却的深渊！这也是不会令人后悔的时间！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Addio, Battler-san...!! Anche se questo è stato il mio unico momento per risplendere! Anche se ho fatto il mio tempo e sto per essere lanciata di nuovo nelle profondità dell'oblio! Anche se, io non ho rimpianti!!"

Umineko Project (UP): "W‐wait!!!"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): And they were plunging their fangs and fists into the walls and windows, trying to crush them.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、壁や窓を破ろうと、牙や拳を打ち付けるのだ。
Russian (RU): И они впивались клыками и кулаками в стены и окна, пытаясь разрушить их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas estão tentando enfiar suas presas e punhos nas paredes e janelas, tentando passar por elas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 並且，為了打破牆壁和窗戶，在用牙和拳頭不斷擊打。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 并且，为了打破墙壁和窗户，在用牙和拳头不断击打。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E stavano affondando le loro zanne e i loro pugni nei muri e nelle finestre, cercando di romperli.

Steam (ST): So, anyone watching the goats stuck to all the windows in the hallway, smashing their thick arms against the windows, ...couldn't help but be terrified, even if they knew about the barrier.
Umineko Project (UP): So, there were goats stuck to all the windows in the hallway, smashing their thick arms against the windows in a way that would terrify anyone, even if they knew about the barrier.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, there were goats stuck to all the windows in the hallway, smashing their thick arms against the windows in a way that would terrify anyone, even if they knew about the barrier.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、廊下中の窓にびっしりと山羊たちがしがみ付き、窓をその豪腕で叩き続ける様子は、たとえ結界で守られているとわかっていても、怯えずにはいられぬものだった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому некоторые козлоголовые застряли во всех окнах коридора, разбивая толстые руки об окна так, что напугали бы кого угодно, даже если они знали о барьере.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E tem também cabras agarradas às janelas do corredor, batendo com seus imensos braços contra as janelas, assustando a todos, mesmo eles sabendo que a barreira ainda estava de pé.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，走廊上的玻璃被密密麻麻的山羊們啃咬，用那粗手臂不停敲擊窗戶的樣子，就算知道自己被結界保護著，也還是會害怕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，走廊上的玻璃被密密麻麻的山羊们啃咬，用那粗手臂不停敲击窗户的样子，就算知道自己被结界保护着，也还是会害怕。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, c'erano caproni attaccati a tutte le finestre del corridoio, sbattendo le loro spesse braccia contro le finestre in una maniera che terrorizzerebbe chiunque, anche se sapesse della barriera.

Steam (ST): However, anyone watching the group of goats gathered at the top of the big staircase on the other side of the barrier would probably feel a different emotion.
Umineko Project (UP): However, anyone watching the group of goats gathered at the top of the big staircase from the safety of the other side of the barrier would probably feel a different emotion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, anyone watching the group of goats gathered at the top of the big staircase on the other side of the barrier would probably feel a different emotion.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、窓ではなく、大階段の上で結界越しに山羊の群れを見る者は、他の感情を抱くだろう。
Russian (RU): Но все те, кто наблюдал за группой козлоголовых, столпившихся на большой лестнице по другую сторону барьера, испытывали другую эмоцию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, qualquer um observando o grupo de cabras se amontoando no topo da grande escadaria do lado oposto à segurança da barreira, provavelmente sentiria uma emoção diferente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，不是窗戶，而是大樓梯那邊透過結界俯視山羊群的人們，心裡有著別樣的感覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，不是窗户，而是大楼梯那边透过结界俯视山羊群的人们，心里有着别样的感觉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, guardando il gruppo di caproni riuniti in cima alla grande scalinata dall'altro lato della barriera, chiunque proverebbe un'emozione diversa.

Steam (ST): Rather than terror, ...it was a sad, empty sort of emotion.
Umineko Project (UP): Instead of terror, ......it was a sad, empty sort of emotion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Instead of terror, ......it was a sad, empty sort of emotion.
PC Japanese (JP): それは恐怖ではなく、……ある種の悲しさと、虚しさだった。
Russian (RU): Вместо ужаса...... эта эмоция была печальной и пустой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao invés do terror, ......seria uma emoção triste e vazia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那不是恐怖，……而是某種悲傷和，空虛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那不是恐怖，……而是某种悲伤和，空虚。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Invece di terrore... era un triste, vuoto tipo di emozione.

Steam (ST): The barrier was drawn across the landing at the top of the hall's great staircase.
Umineko Project (UP): The barrier was drawn across the landing at the top of the hall's great staircase.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The barrier was drawn across the landing at the top of the hall's great staircase.
PC Japanese (JP): ホールの大階段は、踊り場の境で結界を張られている。
Russian (RU): Барьер протянулся наверху главной лестницы зала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A barreira foi traçada cruzando o patamar do topo da grande escadaria do hall.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大廳的大樓梯，在樓梯平台的位置上展開了結界。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大厅的大楼梯，在楼梯平台的位置上展开了结界。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La barriera era estesa attraverso il pianerottolo in cima alla grande scalinata dell'ingresso.

Steam (ST): Beyond that barrier, ...everything had already been eaten away.
Umineko Project (UP): Beyond that barrier, ......everything had already been eaten away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beyond that barrier, ......everything had already been eaten away.
PC Japanese (JP): その結界の向こうは、……すでに、何もかもが食い尽くされてしまった。
Russian (RU): За этим барьером...... всё уже было съедено.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além da barreira, ......tudo já havia sido devorado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那結界的另一邊，……所有的一切，都已經被吞食殆盡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那结界的另一边，……所有的一切，都已经被吞食殆尽了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Oltre quella barriera... tutto era stato divorato.

Steam (ST): Was it even possible for those who stood in the hallway of the upper floors to believe that this was the Rokkenjima mansion?
Umineko Project (UP): Was it even possible for those who stood in the hallway of the upper floors to believe that this was the Rokkenjima mansion?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Was it even possible for those who stood in the hallway of the upper floors to believe that this was the Rokkenjima mansion?
PC Japanese (JP): 上の階の廊下にいる者には、自分たちが、六軒島の屋敷の中にいると信じることが出来るだろう。
Russian (RU): Могут ли те, кто стоит в коридорах верхних этажей, полагать, что это особняк Роккенджимы?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era mesmo possível para aqueles que permaneciam no corredor do andar superior, acreditar que essa era a mansão de Rokkenjima?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在樓上的走廊上的人們，還能相信自己是在六軒島的大屋之中吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在楼上的走廊上的人们，还能相信自己是在六轩岛的大屋之中吧？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era anche possibile per coloro che stavano nel corridoio dei piani superiori credere che questa era la villa di Rokkenjima?

Steam (ST): By now, ...no one looking at this scene would be able to imagine such a thing.
Umineko Project (UP): By now, ......no one looking at this scene would be able to imagine such a thing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、ここにいて、……この光景を見ている者には、もはやそう思い込むことは出来ない。
Russian (RU): Теперь...... ни один человек, видящий эту сцену, не смог бы представить такое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora, ......ninguém olhando essa cena seria capaz de imaginar tal coisa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，站在這裡，……看著這幅光景的人們，已經無法這樣想了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，站在这里，……看着这幅光景的人们，已经无法这样想了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Da quel momento... nessuno guardando questa scena, sarebbe in grado di immaginare una cosa simile.

Steam (ST): Forget the hall or even the whole first floor... Even the ground itself was almost gone.
Umineko Project (UP): Forget the hall or even the whole first floor...... Even the ground itself was almost gone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Forget the hall or even the whole first floor...... Even the ground itself was almost gone.
PC Japanese (JP): ホールはおろか、１階も、……そもそも大地さえもなくなろうとしている。
Russian (RU): Да что там зал или весь первый этаж...... Даже самой земли почти не осталось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esqueça o hall ou até mesmo o primeiro andar...... Tudo, até mesmo o solo já tinha sumido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不用說大廳了，1 層也，……就連大地也完全沒有了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不用说大厅了，1 层也，……就连大地也完全没有了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dimenticate il ritratto e persino l'intero piano terra... anche il terreno stesso era quasi scomparso.

Steam (ST): The sea of goats had eaten everything apart long before this.
Umineko Project (UP): The sea of goats had eaten everything apart long before this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The sea of goats had eaten everything apart long before this.
PC Japanese (JP): 山羊の海は、とっくの昔に全てを食い尽くしていた。
Russian (RU): Море козлоголовых давным‐давно разъело всё.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O mar de cabras havia comido tudo há tempos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 山羊之海，早就將這些全部吞食了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 山羊之海，早就将这些全部吞食了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il mare di caproni aveva già divorato tutto molto prima.

Steam (ST): They had eaten apart the hall, the pillars of the mansion, the floor, the ground, the sea, the very concept of the island... Every part of the game board Battler had created.
Umineko Project (UP): They had eaten apart the hall, the pillars of the mansion, the floor, the ground, the sea, the very concept of the island......every part of the game board Battler had created.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They had eaten apart the hall, the pillars of the mansion, the floor, the ground, the sea, the very concept of the island......every part of the game board Battler had created.
PC Japanese (JP): ホールを食い尽くし、屋敷の柱を食い尽くし、床も、大地も、海も、概念も、……戦人の生み出したゲーム盤の全てを食い尽くした。
Russian (RU): Они пожрали зал, столбы особняка, пол, землю, море, само понятие острова...... всю игровую доску, созданную Баттлером.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas haviam devorado o hall, os pilares da mansão, o piso, o solo, o mar, o próprio conceito da ilha......toda e cada parte do tabuleiro que Battler havia criado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 將大廳吃光，將大屋的柱子吃光，地板、大地、海、甚至概念，……將戰人做出的遊戲盤的一切吃得精光。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 将大厅吃光，将大屋的柱子吃光，地板、大地、海、甚至概念，……将战人做出的游戏盘的一切吃得精光。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Avevano divorato l'ingresso, i pilastri della villa, il pavimento, il terreno, il mare, il concetto stesso dell'isola... ogni parte del piano da gioco che Battler aveva creato.

Steam (ST): And now, the only leftover was the upper part of the mansion, which floated along in empty space.
Umineko Project (UP): And now, the only leftover was the upper part of the mansion, which floated along in empty space.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And now, the only leftover was the upper part of the mansion, which floated along in empty space.
PC Japanese (JP): 今や、この屋敷は、上半分の食い残しのみが、虚無の空間に漂っているのだ。
Russian (RU): И осталась только верхушка особняка, парящая в пустом пространстве.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E agora, tudo o que restara foi o andar superior da mansão, que flutuava sobre um espaço vazio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 現在，這間大屋，只剩下上面的一半，漂浮在虛無的空間裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 现在，这间大屋，只剩下上面的一半，漂浮在虚无的空间里。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E adesso, l'unico avanzo era la parte superiore della villa, che fluttuava nello spazio vuoto.

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "...How {f:5:pitiful}."
Umineko Project (UP): "......How {f:5:pitiful}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......How PITIFUL."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……哀れなことデス。」
Russian (RU): "......Какое {f:5:убожество}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......É mesmo {f:5:lamentável}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……真是可悲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Com'è PIETOSO."

Speaker: Gertrude
Steam (ST): "To what do you refer?"
Umineko Project (UP): "To what do you refer?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「何が也や。」
Russian (RU): "О чём вы?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ao que se refere?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「什麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「什么？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "A cosa si riferisce?"

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "...The goats, in their eagerness to chew this island apart, have eaten up even the ground they stood on, dropping themselves into {f:5:nothingness}."
Umineko Project (UP): "......The goats, in their eagerness to chew this island apart, have eaten up even the ground they stood on, dropping themselves into {f:5:nothingness}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......The goats, in their eagerness to chew this island apart, have eaten up even the ground they stood on, dropping themselves into NOTHINGNESS."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……この島を食い尽くすという快楽に身を任せた山羊たちが、自分たちの足場さえ食い尽くし、虚無に落ちて、消えてイク。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……この島を食い尽くすという快楽に身を任せた山羊たちが、自分たちの足場さえ食い尽くし、虚無に落ちて、消えてイク」
Russian (RU): "......В своём стремлении разжевать остров козлоголовые грызут даже землю, на которой стоят, падая в {f:5:небытие}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......As cabras, em sua avidez de consumir a ilha, devoraram o solo abaixo delas, jogando a si mesmas no {f:5:nada}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……沉浸於將島吃光的快樂中的山羊們，連自己的落腳之處都吃掉，落入虛無而消失。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……沉浸于将岛吃光的快乐中的山羊们，连自己的落脚之处都吃掉，落入虚无而消失。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... I caproni, nel loro desiderio di divorare quest'isola, hanno mangiato anche il terreno su cui si trovavano, gettandosi nel NULLA."

Steam (ST): This had once been a huge entrance hall.
Umineko Project (UP): This had once been a huge entrance hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): かつてそこは、広大なホールだった。
Russian (RU): Когда‐то здесь была огромная прихожая.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Este fora o grande hall de entrada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 過去這裡是，寬廣的大廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 过去这里是，宽广的大厅。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Un tempo questo era stato un enorme ingresso.

Steam (ST): Beyond it had been a vast rose garden. ...There had been so many places to stand upon.
Umineko Project (UP): Beyond it had been a vast rose garden. ......There had been so many places to stand upon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beyond it had been a vast rose garden. ......There had been so many places to stand upon.
PC Japanese (JP): ホールの外には広大な薔薇庭園。……足の踏み場はいくらでもあった。
Russian (RU): За ней простирался обширный розарий. ......Было столько мест, на которых можно стоять.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além dele havia um vasto jardim de rosas. ......Tinham muitos lugares para se destacar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大廳之外是寬廣的玫瑰庭園。……踏腳的地方有的是。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大厅之外是宽广的玫瑰庭园。……踏脚的地方有的是。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Oltre di esso c'era stato un vasto giardino di rose. ... C'erano stati così tanti posti su cui stare.

Steam (ST): However, now, ...holes had been dug everywhere, and nearly everything outside the mansion was completely gone.
Umineko Project (UP): However, now, ......holes had been dug everywhere, and nearly everything outside the mansion was completely gone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, now, ......holes had been dug everywhere, and nearly everything outside the mansion was completely gone.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし今や、……そこかしこは穴だらけで、もはや屋敷の外だった部分は完全に虚空。
Russian (RU): Но теперь...... повсюду вырыты дыры, и почти всё снаружи особняка полностью исчезло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, agora, ......buracos haviam sido abertos por todo lado, e praticamente todo o exterior da mansão tinha desaparecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是現在，……到處都是洞，大屋之外的部分已經幾乎完全是虛空。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是现在，……到处都是洞，大屋之外的部分已经几乎完全是虚空。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, ora... dei buchi erano stati fatti ovunque, e quasi tutto fuori dalla villa era completamente scomparso.

Steam (ST): Some goats were clutching to the few remaining footholds and pillars, still eating away at them.
Umineko Project (UP): Some goats were clutching to the few remaining footholds and pillars, still eating away at them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Some goats were clutching to the few remaining footholds and pillars, still eating away at them.
PC Japanese (JP): わずかに残った足場や柱などにしがみ付き、山羊たちはそれでもなお、ばりばりと貪り食っているのだ。
Russian (RU): Некоторые козлоголовые жались к немногим оставшимся опорам и столбам, всё равно разъедая их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Algumas cabras estavam se agarrando nos poucos apoios e pilares restantes, enquanto ainda continuavam a devorá‐los.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 扒著僅存的一點落腳處和柱子，山羊們即便身處這種情況，還在不停地貪食著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 扒着仅存的一点落脚处和柱子，山羊们即便身处这种情况，还在不停地贪食着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Alcuni caproni continuavano ad azzannare i pochi appigli e pilastri rimanenti, strappandone via i pezzi.

Speaker: Cornelia
Steam (ST): "...Let it be known that exposing the truth is murder."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It should be known that to expose the truth is to kill."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……真実を暴くとは、殺すことと心得るもの也。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……真実を暴くとは、殺すことと心得るもの也」
Russian (RU): "......Да будет известно, что раскрыть правду означает убить."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Deveria ser de conhecimento que expor a verdade é matar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……已領教揭露真實，如同殺人。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……已领教揭露真实，如同杀人。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Dovrebbe essere risaputo che esporre la verità equivale ad uccidere."

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "Why can't humans live without killing, I {f:5:wonder}? ...Throughout their long history, so many have prayed for miracles, ...but in the end, they eat up their own chances at receiving them, eating up the very ground they stand on and falling into the {f:5:abyss}..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Why can't humans live without killing, I {f:5:wonder}. ......Throughout their long history, so many have prayed for miracles, ......but in the end, they eat up their own chances at receiving a miracle, eating up the very ground they stand on and falling into the {f:5:abyss}......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Why can't humans live without killing, I WONDER. ......Throughout their long history, so many have prayed for miracles, ......but in the end, they eat up their own chances at receiving a miracle, eating up the very ground they stand on and falling into the ABYSS......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「人は、なぜ殺さずには、生きられないのデス。……遠大なる歴史の中で、あれだけの大勢が奇跡を願いながら、……結局は奇跡の余地を自ら食い尽くし、自らの足場さえ食い破って、奈落へ落ちてユク……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「人は、なぜ殺さずには、生きられないのデス。……遠大なる歴史の中で、あれだけの大勢が奇跡を願いながら、……結局は奇跡の余地を自ら食い尽くし、自らの足場さえ食い破って、奈落へ落ちてユク……」
Russian (RU): "И почему люди не могут жить не убивая. ......На протяжении своей долгой истории многие молились о чудесах, ......но в итоге уничтожали свои же шансы обрести чудо, пожирая саму землю, на которой стояли, и падая в {f:5:бездну}......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Fico me perguntando o motivo dos humanos não poderem viver sem {f:5:matar}. ......Através de sua longa história, muitos rezaram por milagres, ......mas no fim, eles devoraram as próprias chances de obterem um milagre, consumindo o próprio chão em que se encontravam e caindo no {f:5:abismo}......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「人不知為何，不殺就活不下去。……在遠大的歷史中，有那麼多的人期望過奇跡，……最終卻自己將奇跡發生的餘地吞食，連自己的立足之處都吃掉，落入地獄……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「人不知为何，不杀就活不下去。……在远大的历史中，有那么多的人期望过奇迹，……最终却自己将奇迹发生的余地吞食，连自己的立足之处都吃掉，落入地狱……」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "...If learning means eating away at the same hopes and dreams that keep you alive, ...that would mean humans are born just so they can die. ...We're taught that we have to live. However, almost everything that we accomplish in life ends up killing us..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......If learning means eating away at the same hopes and dreams that keep you alive, .........that would mean humans are born just so they can die. ......We're taught that we have to live. However, almost everything that we accomplish in life ends up killing us..."

PC Japanese (JP): 「……知ることが、自分の生きる夢や希望を自ら食い尽くすことを意味するなら。………人間は、死ぬために生まれてきたってことになる。……私たちは、生きろと教えられます。しかし、生きて成すことのほぼ全てが、結局は自分を殺している…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……知ることが、自分の生きる夢や希望を自ら食い尽くすことを意味するなら。………人間は、死ぬために生まれてきたってことになる。……私たちは、生きろと教えられます。しかし、生きて成すことのほぼ全てが、結局は自分を殺している…」
Russian (RU): "......Если узнавать означает разъедать те же надежды и мечты, благодаря которым живёшь, ......получается, люди рождены просто чтобы умереть. ......Нам говорят жить. Но почти всё, что мы совершаем в жизни, в конце концов убивает нас..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Se aprender significa devorar tudo igual as esperanças e sonhos que o mantém vivo, .........então significa que humanos nascem apenas para poderem morrer. ......Nós aprendemos que temos que viver. Mas quase tudo que realizamos em vida acaba nos matando..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……如果求知就代表著，將自己的夢想和希望都自己吃掉的意義的話。………人類就會變成，是為了去死而被生下來。……我們從小被教導要活下去。但是，活著時所做的事幾乎全部，都是在殺害自己…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……如果求知就代表着，将自己的梦想和希望都自己吃掉的意义的话。………人类就会变成，是为了去死而被生下来。……我们从小被教导要活下去。但是，活着时所做的事几乎全部，都是在杀害自己…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Se imparare significa divorare le stesse speranze e sogni che ti tengono in vita... significherebbe che gli umani sono nati solo per morire. ... Ci viene insegnato che dobbiamo vivere. Altrimenti, praticamente ogni cosa che compiamo in vita finisce con l'ucciderci..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "As a single human, I want to ask. ...Is learning a sin?! Is living in ignorance the only way we can have hopes and dreams...?!"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Como um mero ser humano, eu quero falar. ......Aprender é um crime?! Viver na ignorância é a única forma de manter nossos sonhos e esperanças...?!"

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
